intro: Neomolina brachyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neomolina, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal or semi-arid regions. Neomolina brachyphylla is often found in shrublands and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
